channel.title: windows on Alok's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in windows on Alok's Blog

item.title: Emacs Windows Installation
item.description: Problems with installing Not having msys2 so that pdftools can’t build [install msys] Not having mingw so that sqlite can’t build for org-roam [choco install mingw] Don’t even have to do that. The mingw is installed by msys2. So go to mysys2: there will be folder named mingw64. Add it’s bin to the PATH. pacman -Syu pacman -S base-devel pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-toolchain pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-zlib pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-libpng pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-poppler pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-imagemagick Then find a version that supports modules : emax64.

item.title: Anaconda Windows
item.description: Anaconda Installation in Windows Issue with pyzmq: pip uninstall pyzmq pip install pyzmq Issue with requests conda deactivate conda update --force conda Issue with sqlite3 Find sqlite 3 dll https://www.sqlite.org/download.html Put it into Anaconda3/DLLS/ folder Install Python 3.6 or 3.7 if you want same env for PyTorch as well as for working with TensorFlow-GPU. Anaconda if HTTPS error: conda --config ssl_verify=false Path variable has importance of order. Based on which python you want as default, put that higher in PATH variable list in windows.
